meanings.definition: In a manner that refuses to admit the truth or existence of something.
meanings.sent1: She shook her head denyingly when asked if she ate the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: He denied the accusations denyingly, insisting he was innocent.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed denyingly when accused of stealing the dog's toy.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds hung denyingly over the city, refusing to let the sun shine through.
meanings.sent5: Her eyes glared denyingly at the mirror, not accepting the reflection staring back at her.

meanings.definition: In a way that rejects or contradicts a statement or accusation.
meanings.sent1: The child crossed his arms denyingly, refusing to believe he had to go to bed early.
meanings.sent2: She responded denyingly to the teacher's claim that she didn't finish her homework.
meanings.sent3: The dog barked denyingly at the mailman, as if saying, 'I'm not scared of you!'
meanings.sent4: The river flowed denyingly against the rocks, resisting any attempt to divert its course.
meanings.sent5: The wind howled denyingly through the trees, challenging anyone to stand in its way.
